english.text: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.
english.source: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings

english.text: Have you ever had a dream, Neo, that you were so sure was real? What if you were unable to wake from that dream? How would you know the difference between the dream world and the real world?
We're all pretty bizarre. Some of us are just better at hiding it, that's all.
I'll have 2 number 9s, a number 9 large, a number 9 small, a number 6 with extra dip, two number 45s, a number 7 and one large soda.

You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go...
english.source: Oh, the Places Youâ€™ll Go! Dr Seuss

english.text: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
english.source: J. K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
